snippet.title: News of 'layoffs' at Blue Apron moved the stock today -- here's what's really going on
snippet.content:
Blue Apron shares bounced on Friday after word that it could lay off up to 1,207 employees from its Jersey City, New Jersey facility as it transitions to a newer location 15 miles away.
But the company said it has offered all of its Jersey City employees a transfer to the new facility in Linden. Those who don't accept will lose their jobs.
The potential cuts were disclosed in a required by law, and will be effective October 6, trimming the company's headcount by 24% to 3,995.
A Blue Apron spokesperson said that the layoff notice is merely a formality.
"We've been letting staff in Jersey City know for a few months that they can transfer to the new facility," said Blue Apron's Head of Communications, Nisha Devarajan, by phone. "A majority decided to transfer over and our hope is that everyone stays with the company."
Employees in Jersey City can still choose to transfer until October, Devarajan said, but any employees who don't will lose their jobs.
Blue Apron in March, and says it will create 2,000 jobs in addition to its other fulfillment centres in Arlington, Texas and Richmond, California.
Shares of Blue Apron stock have fallen 40% since their June 29 initial public offering. After Blue Apron cleared up the news, the shares continued their decline.
The company is set to report earnings for the first time next Thursday.
